title: "You have six days to get a group of 5 together and troll with all melee"
body:
And five of those days are weekdays.  
And we don't have a streamlined way of finding other players.
And it has to be a PvP match.
And it goes directly against the strongest iteration of the bot lane meta.
And you have to win.

But we don't want missions to negatively impact your games.

Edit: So there's a loophole:  I knocked this mission out in 20 minutes because we were against another team trying to do the same thing, and our team was much stronger.

Well, Ghostcrawler managed pretty well to piss of a large portion of WoW's player base and managed to get a lot of people to quit permanently. No reason why he wouldn't be able to achieve the same thing here.
I keep hearing his name, what did he do that ruined world of warcraft so much? I used to play a lot but stopped with the release of WOD, but I never kept up with the developers or GM teams.

Well, as always, it takes more than one person to make a change, but still. His role at blizz was: _My team handles everything from mechanics to items to trade skills to achievements to UI design. _

Key word here is "mechanics". Basically he was responsible for where the game was headed in terms of complexity and difficulty. So after he was hired you saw Blizzard changing their design philosophy to "mass appeal" and "casualization". Basically they thought they could draw in more players by the means of radical simplification. The game become dumbed down and easier to get into at the cost of immersion and skill expression, viz any moron can now learn a spec's rotation in 5 minutes whereas before it took a much longer time to perfect your rotation. Catch-up mechanics are too abundant and the game is generally far too easy. Obviously this radical simplification affected PvP and destroyed the balance completely. The reason for this is that PvP was largely ignored when making these changes. There is now a complete void existing in the place of skill expression. The game is much less satisying to play than in its earlier days. As a result WoW saw a massive drop in subscriptions. In Legion it has recovered somewhat, but it's still not where it was at the peak of Wrath.

Can you give GC all the blame for where the game is now? Obviously not, but he did (seemingly) support radical simplification. It worked out poorly, and it's not a design philosophy which people want in League.
"These missions arent meant to harm game play"

Yeah that one is pretty bleh.

I was kind maybe perhaps ok with it as simply "win a matchmade PVP game as all melee", since that leaves open the possibility to do it on TT where an all melee comp is somewhat more viable, or even randomly get it in ARAM if one just spammed enough ARAM games, but requiring a 5 man premade precludes TT, and makes it much more painful to try to get in ARAM (since if you play solo whenever throughout the week maybe fortune will favour you in any one of them, but it's much less practical to be constantly putting together a 5 man and hoping).

Still, we don't need to do it for anything meaningful. The ashe chroma/ward can't be earned for free anyway, and if you do get the pass then you'll have more than enough tokens even skipping it. Getting the ashe border can be done for free even while skipping this mission (and a few other ones likely to be anti-meta), and you wouldn't have enough left over for an orb regardless, so basically people are missing out on a little bit of blue essence by not doing it.

I have to admit, upon Worlds Missions being released as the exclusive way to obtain the chroma for Championship Ashe, not only was I swearing up and down that I was going to get it, but I was also up to here (notions really high) with people posting hate towards the concept.

11 days later, I am now palm to face about the whole thing and eating my own words. (they taste like gravel and some other less than sanitary option)

Not only am I exasperated with gathering points towards the chromas due to this week's payout being lower than last, even with the Master Pass points, but the new mission set is single handedly crippled by that one, Melee Only 5 Man Premade Must Win mission.

There is no way in hell, outside of a custom jerk off game, that I'm going to waste people's time and troll them THAT hard, for a chroma. I'll stick with regular Championship Ashe, thanks for the not april fools laugh.

Sincerely
-An idiot who initially defended this

This week is likely to be quite informative.

I could see this mission not being too big a deal if the people on your team are very good, but for casual players like me... It's just not going to happen. Ever.

What I don't get is ... why are the easier missions (Get 6 kills and / or 13 assists) worth 20 tokens while the harder ones (have a premade of 5 people using all melee) worth only 5 tokens? I mean, the logic behind this is baffling because harder missions should be worth more tokens right?

It's like Riot knew people hate these kinds of missions but instead of being fair and creative, they just lowered the reward for these awful missions which kills any motivation I have in completing said missions (i'll still complete the easier ones but my point stands).

My only question is ... why did Riot repeat their mistake after the community's outcry about the Star Guardian missions?
